alert.note: Alert for Grafton; Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 7:20PM EDT until July 08 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Grafton. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Rainfall rates at storm centers are estimated to be between 3 and 5 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, Plymouth, New London, Grafton, Hanover, Haverhill, Enfield, Canaan, Danbury and Groton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
